result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew D. Herbst

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 9:08am. Defendant Matthew D. Herbst in court.  Attorney Todd Allen Snow Esq in court for Matthew D. Herbst.  Prosecuting attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra in court for the State of Wisconsin. Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 30 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't
Letter from defendant to Judge Snow

8:57 AM Defendant Matthew D. Herbst in court.  Prosecuting attorney Kurt Frederich Klomberg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held. Court sets another review hearing, PH to remain on calendar.
Review hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Review hearing on October 5, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

12:41 PM Defendant Matthew D. Herbst appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Kurt Frederich Klomberg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Alyssa George Stifler appears - not eligible. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $5000 cash bond with conditions: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.
Review hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.
